result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. TYLER MICHAEL VINTON

No resolution at this time. 
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for TYLER MICHAEL VINTON
Current: 1849 US Hwy 63, Comstock, WI 54826 United States  (Effective: 09-16-2022)
Prior: 611 N EMERY ST; #12; NOT CURRENT, STANLEY, WI 54768

BOND APPLIES TO 22CF488, 22CF455 & 22CF437 
$250 posted 7/14/2022.
CASH BOND MODIFIED FOR THE PUROSE OF PLACEMENT AT A GROUP HOME.  DEFENDANT IS TO RETURN TO THE CUSTODY OF THE JAIL IF HE VOLUNTARILY LEAVE THE GROUP HOME.  
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
No contact with IGA in Stanley, WI
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / any syringes unless medically required. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol / any illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed. 
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
No contact with Victim 1 or their residence.
No contact with the Snout Saloon or the apartments at 13 W Central St or 15 W Central St in Chippewa Falls.
Bond modification granted to allow group home placement
Review hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:05 AM Defendant TYLER MICHAEL VINTON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney George E. Miller in court for TYLER MICHAEL VINTON.  Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Miller requests to modify bond to a signature bond upon release to a group home. 
ADA Yohnk stipulates to bond modification but requests the signature bond to be converted back to cash bond if defendant leaves the group home. 
Court will modify cash bond to signature bond upon release to the group home. 
Court orders defendant to return to the custody of the jail if defendant voluntarily leaves the group home.
